results.title: The Opening: National Gallery of Victoria
results.brief_description: An ABC-TV Outside broadcast introduced by Peter Couchman. The National Gallery of Victoria’s new building, the dream of the Director of the Gallery, Mr. Eric Westbrook, for twelve years came to fruition after four years of planning. The architect, Roy Grounds’ “Vision Splendid” has become a reality and Stage 1 of Victoria’a new art and cultural centre is opened. An on-the-spot film of the opening ceremony in the Great Hall and speech by the Rt. Hon. Sir Henry Bolte. Fanfare composed by George Dreyfus.

results.title: The Olympic road: Tokyo 1964
results.brief_description: A survey of the preparations for the 1964 Olympic Games to be held in Tokyo. Shows many Japanese athletes in intensive training for twenty events of the Olympic Games.

results.title: The Nuremberg Chronicle
results.creator_credit: John Frazer, Russell T Limbach and Weslyan University
results.brief_description: Explores the handsome woodcuts that illustrate the Nuremberg Chronicle - a history of the world published in 1493 - giving the account of history as it was known in 1493 from the Creation to the Final Judgement that was predicted to be coming soon. The film conveys something of people’s hopes, fears and beliefs at a time in history when old ways and ideas were changing radically.

results.title: The North of Russia
results.brief_description: A documentary, produced in a travelogue style, that looks at the country, the people, the architecture and other aspects of Northern Russia.

results.title: The New world: auto pilot
results.brief_description: The film shows a series of blind landings, made entirely by an “Auto-Pilot.” It is installed in the Trident aircraft, the first to be designed from the outset for automatic landing. From inside the aircraft, the film follows the full operation of automatic landings, and explains how the system works. There are also interviews with a test pilot, an aircraft captain and passengers

results.title: The Nature of tuberculosis
results.brief_description: Shows infected lung, tuberculosis operation in Japan, the infection and how it grows, removal of the infected part and possible treatment with rest and new drugs. Supervised by Dr Hideo Kumabe with technical guidance by the Research Institute for Tuberculosis of the Anti-tuberculosis Association Japan.

results.title: The Nature of life: the living cell
results.brief_description: Photomicrography investigates single-celled and multi-celled organisms - how they produce or absorb food, convert food to energy, respond to their environments, and reproduce. Simple experiments seen through a standard microscope demonstrate the functions of cell structures; an electron microscope reveals smaller cell structures.

results.title: The National driver's test
results.creator_credit: Vern Diamond, Warren V. Bush and CBS News (for Shell)
results.brief_description: Designed to test the viewer’s judgement, knowledge and perception as a driver. Emphasises the importance of anticipating the wrong actions of other drivers and the learning of “defensive” driving techniques. Includes section on high-speed highway accidents. Made with the co-operation of the National Safety Council (USA) and the IBM Corporation. Introduced briefly by Stuart Wagstaff.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball
results.brief_description: Five of America’s most respected and talented coaches analyse every aspect of the game of basketball. Lucius Mitchell examines the development of the big man; Bill Foster, the running game; Gene Barton relates the drills that his players use to develop individual offensive skills; Norm Stewart analyses the jump shot and one-hand free throw; Bobby Knight looks at team defence.

results.title: The Music of Erich Zann
results.creator_credit: John Strysik, Robert Rothman and Essential Saltes Productions
results.brief_description: Set in late nineteenth century Paris, the film follows the efforts of Charles Dexter Ward, a young American student, to make the acquaintance of an ageing musician who lives a secluded life in the room above him at a boarding house. Ward is fascinated, then driven to unravel the mysterious circumstances surrounding Zann and his music: he wants to learn why Zann plays wondrous, often awesomely compelling music late at night. Based on a short story by H.P. Lovecraft.
